cvrfdoc.document_title: Red Hat Security Advisory: python-psutil security update
cvrfdoc.document_distribution: Copyright Â© 2021 Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

full_product_name.product_name: python-psutil-0:5.4.3-11.el8 as a component of Red Hat Enterprise Linux AppStream (v. 8)

notes.note: python-psutil: Double free because of refcount mishandling

reference.description: bz#1772014: CVE-2019-18874 python-psutil: Double free because of refcount mishandling

remediation.description:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:
https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

acknowledgment.description: This issue was discovered by Riccardo Schirone (Red Hat).

note:
An update for python-psutil is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.
Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.

psutil is a module providing an interface for retrieving information on all running processes and system utilization (CPU, memory, disks, network, users) in a portable way by using Python.
Security Fix(es):
* python-psutil: double free because of refcount mishandling (CVE-2019-18874)
For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
Additional Changes:
For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.5 Release Notes linked from the References section.
